title: rewards for reformed players?
body: now before you say that the reward for being a reformed player is being able to play league of legends. I would say that is not the case. my idea for a reward is like a purple ribbon to show who is a changed player and who is a toxic player.

replies.body: We should also give rewards to child molesters who no longer rape kids.

Why would you give a reward to a terrible person who insists they are no longer a terrible person?
That's like saying "I didn't commit another felony today, so I should be rewarded."
Currently the reward is access to hextech crafting.
you get to have hex tech crafting.

The concern with giving rewards to reformed players is that it creates an environment where the 'ideal' (for the purpose of acquiring content) involves being toxic enough to get a punishment in the first place. Which is to say, create an even worse gaming experience.

Keep in mind though, Riot does offer end-of-season rewards to reformed players IN ADDITION to regular, unpunished players. And hextech crafting. And not being banned from the game. Sometimes summoner icons or small amounts of rp
